{"step_by_step_thinking": "Classic hemophilia, also known as Hemophilia A, is a genetic disorder that leads to a deficiency in clotting factor 8. This deficiency prevents the blood from clotting effectively, leading to excessive bleeding. To assure surgical hemostasis in these patients, it is necessary to replace the missing clotting factor. Whole blood and fresh frozen plasma contain many different components, not just factor 8, and may not provide a sufficient amount of this specific clotting factor. Factor 9 concentrate is used to treat Hemophilia B, not Hemophilia A. Therefore, the best blood product to administer preoperatively to patients with classic hemophilia is Factor 8 concentrate.", "answer_choice": "B. Factor 8 concentrate"}
